summary: The work focuses on three main initiatives: introducing new VMS products (Meal Shake and Creatine) requiring extensive setup across multiple services, fixing One-Time Purchase (OTP) UAT issues related to UI/UX and messaging, and implementing quick wins like modifying 'Add to cart' behavior. The new product introduction involves coordinated work across product catalogs, pricing services, content management, and feature flags.

decisions.what: Add to cart button should open sliding cart instead of taking users to checkout page
decisions.rationale: Improve user experience by allowing shoppers to review cart before proceeding to checkout

decisions.what: Use feature flags (Statsig) to control rendering of new products
decisions.rationale: Enable controlled rollout and ability to enable/disable new products without deployment

decisions.what: Allow VMS subscribers to purchase OTP items by modifying checkout restrictions
decisions.rationale: Remove artificial limitation preventing VMS subscribers from buying one-time purchase items

decisions.what: Add California Prop 65 disclaimers for products with ingredients exceeding regulatory limits
decisions.rationale: Comply with California regulations requiring warnings for certain ingredient levels

initiatives.name: Introduce Meal Shake & Creatine to VMS assortment
initiatives.description: Add two new product lines (Meal Shake and Creatine) to the VMS offerings, requiring comprehensive setup across all systems including product catalogs, pricing, content management, images, and product detail pages

initiatives.name: One-Time Purchase (OTP) UAT Fixes
initiatives.description: Address multiple UAT issues discovered during OTP testing, including UI bugs, copy updates, and functionality issues related to subscription vs one-time purchase distinctions

initiatives.name: KTLO (Keep The Lights On) Maintenance
initiatives.description: Ongoing maintenance tasks including updating product images and adding regulatory compliance disclaimers

blockers.description: Copy sections for new products cannot be created until designs are finalized
blockers.impact: Blocks content creation in Lokalise for new Meal Shake and Creatine products

blockers.description: Greens PDP image update flagged until assets are available
blockers.impact: Cannot update Greens product images on product detail page

blockers.description: Updated copy needed for Welcome Kit SNS orders
blockers.impact: Cannot update Welcome Kit messaging to clarify SNS-only applicability

entities.name: Emily Mendelson
entities.context: Mentioned in comments requesting updated copy for Welcome Kit

entities.context: Assigned to OTP UAT dashboard shipping status bug

entities.context: Service where new product SKUs need to be created with required schema

entities.context: Service where pricing information for new products needs to be added

entities.name: CCM
entities.context: Content management system where recipes, menus, and menu slot selections need to be created for new products

entities.context: Database catalog where new SKUs with specs and image links need to be created

entities.name: Lokalise
entities.context: Localization platform where copy sections for new products need to be created

entities.name: Statsig
entities.context: Feature flag management system for controlling new product rendering

entities.name: AWS S3
entities.context: Storage bucket for product images to be served through CDN

entities.name: Google Drive
entities.context: Storage location for new product images before AWS upload

entities.name: Daily Greens
entities.context: Product requiring image updates and Prop 65 disclaimers

entities.name: Meal Shake
entities.context: New product being introduced to VMS assortment

entities.name: Creatine
entities.context: New product being introduced to VMS assortment

entities.name: California Prop 65
entities.context: Regulatory compliance requirement for ingredient warnings

technical_patterns.context: New products require coordinated updates across products-service, price-service, MongoDB catalog, CCM, Lokalise, and AWS S3 - indicating a distributed product data architecture
Using Statsig for feature flags to control new product visibility, enabling gradual rollout and quick rollback capability
Products are managed through SKUs with spreadsheet-based generation using macros, then distributed to various services via CSV files
Images stored in AWS S3 and served through CDN for performance optimization
Moving from direct checkout navigation to sliding cart overlay for better user experience and cart review
System distinguishes between subscription (SNS) and one-time purchase (OTP) orders with different messaging, restrictions, and user flows

dependencies.context: Copy creation for new products blocked until designs are finalized
Greens image updates waiting on asset delivery from commercial team
Welcome Kit and discount messaging updates require copy from content team
Product service depends on CSV files generated from SKU spreadsheet macros
Product catalog references images stored in S3 and served via CDN
UI rendering of new products controlled by feature flags in Statsig
Checkout depends on pricing information from price-service
